features: AMD Ryzen 7 7700X Desktop Processor, 8-Core, 16-Thread, 5.4 GHz Max Boost, unlocked for overclocking, 40 MB cache, DDR5-5200 support, default TDP 105W. This dominant gaming processor can deliver fast 100+ FPS performance in the world's most popular games
For the state-of-the-art Socket AM5 platform, can support PCIe 5.0 on select 600 Series motherboards. OS Support: Windows 11/ 10-64-Bit Edition. Cooler & Thermal Solution (PIB) not included

GIGABYTE B650M DS3H Gaming Motherboard, Micro ATX Form Factor, AMD Socket AM5, 4 x DDR5 DIMM sockets supporting up to 128 GB, Dual channel memory architecture, 2 x M.2 PCIe 4.0 x4 connectors, 4 x SATA 6Gb/s, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type C support, Supports AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Processors

Unparalleled Performance：Direct 6+2+1 Phases Digital VRM Solution./ Dual Channel DDR5：4*SMD DIMMs with AMD EXPO & Intel XMP Memory Module Support./ SuperSpeed Storage：2*PCIe 4.0 x4 M.2 Connectors./ Advanced Thermal Design & M.2 Thermal Guard：To Ensure VRM Power Stability & 25110 M.2 SSD Performance

EZ-Latch：PCIe x16 Slot with Quick Release Design./ Fast Networks：2.5GbE LAN./ Extended Connectivity：2*DP, HDMI, 2*USB-C 10Gb/s./ Smart Fan 6：Features Multiple Temperature Sensors, Hybrid Fan Headers with FAN STOP./ Q-Flash Plus：Update BIOS Without Installing the CPU, Memory and Graphics Card

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: AMD Ryzen 7 7700X CPU Processor Specification Cores/ Threads 8/ 16 Max. Boost Clock Up to 5.4GHz Base Clock 4.5GHz L1 Cache 512KB L2+L3 Cache 40MB Default TDP 105W Unlocked for Overclocking Yes CPU Socket AM5 Thermal Solution (PIB) Not included Max. Operating Temperature 95°C PCI Express Version PCIe 5.0 System Memory Type DDR5 Memory Channels 2 Intergrated Graphic AMD Radeon Graphics Graphics Core Count 2 OS Support Windows 11/10 - 64-Bit Edition

GIGABYTE B650M DS3H Gaming Motherboard Specification CPU Socket Type AM5 CPU Type support for: AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Processors Number of Memory Slots 4x288pin (DDR5) Maximum Memory Supported 4 x DDR5 DIMM sockets supporting up to 128 GB ECC Supported Support for non-ECC Un-buffered DIMM 1Rx8/2Rx8/1Rx16 memory modules Buffer Supported Un-buffered SATA 6Gb/s 4 x SATA 6Gb/s M.2 Slot 2 x PCIe 4.0 x4 m.2 connectors (M key) Max LAN Speed Realtek 2.5GbE LAN chip Audio Chipset Realtek Audio CODEC Form Factor Micro ATX Windows Support for Windows 11/ 10 64-bit

Direct 6+2+1 Phases Digital VRM Solution To ensure maximum Turbo Boost and overclocking performance of AMD's new generation CPU, GIGABYTE UD series motherboard equip the best VRM design Direct 6+2+1 Phases Digital VRM Solution ever built with the highest quality components. PCIe 4.0 Hardware Design GIGABYTE B650 Motherboards are ready to work with the PCIe 4.0 devices which are expected to experience twice bandwidth than the current PCIe 3.0 devices. To reach the high speed and maintain good signal integrity, GIGABYTE R&D uses the low impedance PCB to provide the maximum performance. EXPO & XMP Suuport AORUS is offering a tested and proven platform that the memory overclocking capability is able up to 6400 and beyond. All users need to do for achieving this extreme memory performance boost is to ensure that their DDR5 memory modules are AMD EXPO/ Intel XMP capable, the EXPO/XMP function is activated and enabled on their AORUS motherboard. Thermal Design Advanced Thermal Design & M.2 Thermal Guard：To Ensure VRM Power Stability & 25110 M.2 SSD Performance

SMART FAN 6 SMART FAN 6 contains several unique cooling features that ensure gaming PC maintain its performance while staying cool and quiet. Multiple fan headers can support PWM/DC fan and pump, and users can easily define each fan curve based on different temperature sensors across the board via intuitive user interface Hi-Fi Audio High-End Audio Capacitors GIGABYTE motherboards use high-end audio capacitors. These high quality capacitors help deliver high resolution and high fidelity audio to provide the most realistic sound effects for gamers. Audio Noise Guard GIGABYTE motherboards feature an audio noise guard that essentially separates the board’s sensitive analog audio components from potential noise pollution at the PCB level. Multi-key A multi-function reset button that can be reconfigured to other function in BIOS for different user scenarios. ● RGB Switch Turn off all lighting effect on motherboard. ● Direct-To-BIOS Boot into BIOS menu directly without pressing any keyboard button. ● Safe Mode Boot into BIOS safe mode to change specific option without losing other BIOS settings. Q-Flash Plus Update the BIOS easily without installing the CPU, memory and graphics card. With GIGABYTE Q-Flash Plus, you don't need to install the CPU, memory and graphics card nor enter the BIOS menu to flash the BIOS. Just download and save a new BIOS file (rename to gigabyte.bin) on the USB flash drive, then press the dedicated Q-Flash Plus button and you’re good to go!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Superb Upgrade for High-End Gaming
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded to the Micro Center AMD Ryzen 7 7700X bundle with the GIGABYTE B650M DS3H motherboard, and I'm blown away by the quality and performance. The Ryzen 7 7700X, being a current-gen processor, offers a massive performance leap over my old i7 8700k. The 8 cores and 16 threads handle everything I throw at it with ease, making it perfect for both gaming and multitasking.The GIGABYTE B650M DS3H motherboard is a great match for the 7700X. Its build quality is solid, and the features like DDR5 support, PCIe 4.0, and USB 3.2 Gen2X2 Type-C port are future-proof. The 2.5GbE LAN is a nice touch for faster internet connectivity.Speaking of gaming, this setup runs Star Citizen at an average of 70 fps when paired with my 4070 GPU, which is impressive. The smoothness and responsiveness in game are remarkable. It's a huge upgrade from my previous experience with the i7 8700k, where I struggled to get consistent frame rates in such demanding titles.For anyone looking to significantly upgrade their gaming rig, especially coming from older setups like the i7 8700k, I highly recommend this bundle. The Ryzen 7 7700X and GIGABYTE B650M DS3H motherboard combination offers exceptional performance and value, making it a top choice for gamers and power users alike.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Price Combo
reviews.reviewText: The price for this combo blew me away. I have had zero issues and has been an excellent upgrade. Very reliable product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Seemed like a decent deal but put it all together and nothing. Won’t post or boot. Can’t get signal out of it and no power to any USB port. Double checked every possibility. Won’t be purchasing through seller again either. Apparently they won’t ship a replacement only a refund within 30 days of them receiving the return. Refund may be full or partial but it is at their discretion. So don’t buy and don’t buy from this seller. What a waste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not a bad little board
reviews.reviewText: Mini ATX, so smaller than most boards and can fit in a smaller case. I have revision 1.5 which is the latest revision. This will run Ryzen 5000 series, Windows 10 and 11, and it is compatable with TPM2.0 and Secure Boot. It also is capable of running up to 128 GB of DDR-4 3200 RAM! Impressive! I had no problems setting it up with the Ryzen 3600 it came with. I also bought 16GB of Corsair Vengeance LPX which ran perfectly. I also was able to buy a Crucial P3 500GB PCIe Gen3 3D NAND NVMe M.2 SSD which the Win11 o/s went onto. All this for just over $300 with shipping! It has the slightly older 802.11AC Wi-Fi & BT 4.2 which was working once Windows was installed. From there I was able to update windows, download the Gigabyte app center with which I downloaded all the drivers for the chipset, audio, etc. I might point out these drivers were all Microsoft certified and recent! It did not come with a manual but there is a pdf manual on the Gigabyte motherboard support page downloads that was a big help.Great board for those starting a low budget build.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid board, with some flaws
reviews.reviewText: Incredibly easy board to install in a MicroATX case. I was up and running with a fresh Win 11 install in 1hr 38mins. Seems to run stable and keeps temps nice and cool on the Ryzen CPU that installed.Pros:Easy to installSeems to run stable (have been stress testing for 4 hours straight)Booted up on first try; a first for me.Cons:Arrow for CPU install could have been cleared.1 Fan header? Seriously.GIGABYTE software that self installs, does not exist in Win Start Menu, you have to dig for it.GIGABYTE software, crashed mid-install and required removal and re-install.Was it supposed to ship with a manual? I made do without, but there wasn't one included.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really great combo for the price
reviews.reviewText: It was simple to install. The performance is amazing for the price, I highly recommend. I went with the 5600 combo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Micro Center help was awesome!
reviews.reviewText: Not planing to I ended up building a pc. Been years since I’ve done it. I updated the bios no problem but I couldn’t get it to install windows. I troubleshooted on my own but couldn’t figure it out. So Amazon put me in touch with micro center and they helped me figure out it was that the drive I was trying to install on was bad. They were great and helpful. I am more then happy with my motherboard cpu combo!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Load Test it with Heavy Load
reviews.reviewText: Was getting some lockups on BF 2042, using stock Ryzen CPU fan. CPU temps were nominal. Did some Load Test with the Heavy Load utility, and got a BSOD. Promptly returned, thankfully for a refund (thus the 3 stars), and went Intel i7-14700K instead on high end Aorus Z790 board, and have had no issues thankfully.
